decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission P/2023/1976 dated 17 November 2023.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: SO-034-20 Rev C and shall conform in all other respects to the drawings and documentations approved under planning permission P/2023/1976: SO-034-01, SO-034-02 received 21/06/2023, SO-034-03 C, SO-034-04 C, SO-034-05 C, SO-034-07 C received 27/10/2023, SO-034-06 C, SO-034-08 C, SO-034-09 B, SO-034-10 A received 31/10/2023, Energy statement received 03/11/2023, Design and access statement received 13/11/2023
Condition : 3 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 22/05/2024 under planning reference P/2024/0977

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the new house to be known as no.1A Westbury Place or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out without the obtaining of a separate planning permission from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - The windows formed in the south elevation shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening below 1.7 metres above internal floor level. The windows shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than in accordance with the requirements of this condition. 
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy

Condition : 6 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in the development hereby permitted.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.

Condition : 7 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access shall be permanently closed, kerbs/verge/footway reinstated and  Controlled Parking Zone bay added so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement. 

Reason: In order to enhance the pedestrian environment and to confine vehicular access to the permitted points in order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or highway safety along the adjacent highway.
Condition : 8 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 22/05/2024 under planning reference P/2024/0977

Condition : 9 - Secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be installed. The approved facilities shall conform to the current Westtrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance (or such other guidance as shall supersede it) in design and layout and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction. 
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 10 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 22/05/2024 under planning reference P/2024/0977

Condition : 11 - a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a ï¿½% reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.
Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
Condition : 12 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 08/03//2024 under planning reference P/2024/0162
Condition : 13 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 22/05/2024 under planning reference P/2024/0977

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.
Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.
Condition : 15 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 22/05/2024 under planning reference P/2024/0977
Condition : 16 - Development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved on 08/03//2024 under planning reference P/2024/0162

Condition : 17 - During works, an appropriate wheel-washing system shall be operated to remove mud, stones and other extraneous materials from vehicle wheels and chassis' leaving the site, and all departing loads shall be fully covered to ensure no material is deposited on the highway. The exit from the wheel wash shall be a hard, non-porous surface sited as far away from the exit as is possible given the site constraints and kept clean at all times.  Waste water discharged from the wheel wash shall be stored and disposed of on site and not discharged into the public sewer unless soil, stones and any suspended material have first been removed.
The developer shall ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to adjoining properties in accordance with the guidance at https://www.london.gov.uk/file/18750/download?token=zV3ZKTpP. 
Site lighting shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.
All vehicle arrivals and departures shall be supervised and the condition of the highway examined immediately afterwards.  Any materials shed from the vehicle during such movement shall be immediately removed from the highway, and returned to site or carted away for disposal and shall not be washed into the surface water drainage system.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and in the interests of highway safety
Notes:
For the wheel washing system above, the preferred distance between it and the exit to the highway is 100 metres if this is practicable.
If site staff are instructed by a Council Officer to stop vehicle movements to and from the site if any incidents occur, they must comply with the instructions.  For any further advice, contact the Council's Community Environment Team on 020 8583 5070.
description: Removal of condition 18 (parking permit restrictions) following planning permission P/2023/1976 dated 17/11/2023 for erection of a two storey house with refuse and cycle storage
